text: If you have cloned the module in the child theme and it exists at the same path as the original module - you should be able to edit any of it’s componenets (html, css, fields, etc) and the cloned/edited child should take priority over the original in the parent theme
that’s what i thought…. it’s working for the template and for the site stylesheet, but not for the module stylesheet. i wonder if something’s wonky with my upload sync.
Oh are you saying you have a generic stylesheet that isnt taking?
i have a module stylesheet that isn’t taking
i copied the module at the same path, changed the stylesheet, and the changes within the module aren’t reflected. (i didn’t install a new module; that would have changed its ID, i think)
i also put in a different layout template in the child theme, and THAT is working, so i know the theme is active
i’ll get back to this shortly and see if maybe my sync is not working right
Haha sorry I just to make sure we are on the same page it’s a module.css file that isnt working?
yep, i see the parent theme’s module styles, not the child’s.
Interesting - if you change the HTML at all does that update? Or is it just not picking it up at all?
will report back in a bit
